Vulnerabilities: Improper trust in client IP address
SecurityMeasures: Access restrictions based on client IP address

Steps.Description: Manipulate the HTTP Host header to bypass the reverse proxy.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to manipulate the Host header to redirect the request to a specific IP address.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sends a request to the target application with a custom Host header pointing to the desired IP address.
StepDetails.Result: The request is redirected to the /api/true-answer endpoint on the loopback network (127.0.0.1).

Steps.Description: Exploit insecure direct object reference (IDOR) to access the hidden flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to access the hidden flag by bypassing the access restrictions based on client IP address.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker accesses the /q endpoint, which displays the contents of the /api/answer endpoint.
StepDetails.Result: The contents of the /api/true-answer endpoint are displayed, revealing the hidden flag.
